item.title:
RT by @lxjhk: Solana 2.2 crates are out. Now you can use SDK types without depending on the whole SDK.
This is a cataclysmic event for dependency trees. Mass deforestation imminent. Compile times to be reduced by orders of magnitude.
There will be real semver too

item.title:
thanks for the effort but i feel compelled to clarify the following:
we will not be compatible with Solidity or EVM. I am against any chain supporting multiple VMs. It hurts interoperability. I also find EVM inferior due to TPS bottlenecks and bad UX (approve and then swap, only a single instruction in a tx, ....)
1MM TPS yes but not 1.2MM which is not yet tested.
there is no SEVM (i don't understand what this is) and I don't have a way to make EVM -> SEVM
there is no bridge between ETH and SOL. We are a scaling solution for Solana, transparent to end users which is a key innovation here.
we don't allocate assets dynamically. we do have an optimized solana validator with 100% mev kick back and 0% commission + sharing rewards + building more profitable blocks. so $ssol has the highest yield.
block production error rate < 0.0001% ‚Äì no such claim
we are very different from eigen ‚Äì oh yeah, you've got this right ‚Äì we redesigned from first principles to make sure the yield is organic
12 patents ‚Äì‚Äì no such thing ‚Äì i only have a pending one on efficient hardened derivation in mpc setting
chainlink wintermute ‚Äì no no no no no, at least i have never spoked with them.
block production 40% more efficient ‚Äì hummm i don't understand the claim but i am gonna say no..
we don't have Baas. we are not partnering up with AWS in any way. we don't even use AWS.
we don;t have a LST bridge.... most of the tvl is just our liquid staking $ssol. we do a lot better in apy because of our validator optimization (which led to the chain)
again, no SEVM....
"attracted 327 projects from ethereum" - i wish. man. not there yet. more likely solana apps will flock over.
----
well i don't know what ai you are using... i recommend switching to a better one.
but again thanks for trying
item.dc:creator: @lxjhk
item.description:
thanks for the effort but i feel compelled to clarify the following:

we will not be compatible with Solidity or EVM. I am against any chain supporting multiple VMs. It hurts interoperability. I also find EVM inferior due to TPS bottlenecks and bad UX (approve and then swap, only a single instruction in a tx, ....)

1MM TPS yes but not 1.2MM which is not yet tested.

there is no SEVM (i don't understand what this is) and I don't have a way to make EVM -> SEVM

there is no bridge between ETH and SOL. We are a scaling solution for Solana, transparent to end users which is a key innovation here.

we don't allocate assets dynamically.
we do have an optimized solana validator with 100% mev kick back and 0% commission + sharing rewards + building more profitable blocks. so $ssol has the highest yield.

block production error rate < 0.0001% ‚Äì no such claim

we are very different from eigen ‚Äì oh yeah, you've got this right ‚Äì we redesigned from first principles to make sure the yield is organic

12 patents ‚Äì‚Äì no such thing ‚Äì i only have a pending one on efficient hardened derivation in mpc setting

chainlink wintermute ‚Äì no no no no no, at least i have never spoked with them.

block production 40% more efficient ‚Äì hummm i don't understand the claim but i am gonna say no..

we don't have Baas. we are not partnering up with AWS in any way. we don't even use AWS.

we don;t have a LST bridge.... most of the tvl is just our liquid staking $ssol. we do a lot better in apy because of our validator optimization (which led to the chain)

again, no SEVM....

"attracted 327 projects from ethereum" - i wish. man. not there yet. more likely solana apps will flock over.

----

well i don't know what ai you are using... i recommend switching to a better one.

but again thanks for trying

item.title:
RT by @lxjhk: Solana, the most actively used L1 blockchain, offers a multitude of advantages.
How does Solana SVM enhance scalability, enable interoperability, and unlock untapped liquidity?
Join with top-tier projects of SVM Alliance: @SonicSVM, @soon_svm, and @solayer_labs ‚Äîas we discuss and explore more details about the future of SVM in 2025.
Tune in on Feb. 5th at 3 PM UTC for the latest insights! https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MnxnDPDRVwGO
